channel.title: Carnivals and Fesitvals on Behaviorism and Mental Health
channel.description: Recent content in Carnivals and Fesitvals on Behaviorism and Mental Health

item.title: Grand Rounds at codeblog: tales of a nurse
item.description: Gina has taken time from her busy schedule as an Intensive Care Nurse to host Grand Rounds this week - the seventh time she has hosted GR.   Stop by when you get a chance, and you’ll find some good reading material.

item.title: Grand Rounds at Health Business Blog
item.description: This week’s Grand Rounds is hosted by David Williams at Health Business Blog.   As usual, there is plenty of good reading.  Pranab’s post Trick or Treat: Do Doctors Encourage Poor Patient Behaviors, at the blog Scepticemia is well-written, interesting, and says as much about behavior as it does about medicine.

item.title: Grand Rounds at Laika's MedLibLog
item.description:
Jacqueline (aka Laika) has this week’s Grand Rounds up at Laika’s MedLibLog.

One might wonder if many posts could be found that fit the theme:  Data, Information, and Communication.   There are approximately fifty posts in this Rounds, so many that you will want to go back several times, so as not to miss anything interesting.  Dr. Herb Mathewson has a post - Want to Go Dutch…or French…or German? - on learning about other countries’ healthcare systems.  There are several posts about social media and medicine - too many to mention, but obviously a source of information for those interested in learning more about this subject - most appropriate for those of us who are of an older, pre-computer age.  Some posts are very serious (My Review of Lifetime’s Movie: Five), while others, such as  ZDoggMD’s Doctors Today, are of a lighter nature.  Stop by and have a look.

item.title: Grand Rounds at Healthcare Economist
item.description: It’s time for this week’s Grand Rounds, which can be found at Healthcare Economist.  Jason has put together an interesting set of posts, everything from a book review to a post about the iPhone.  Stop by for some enjoyable reading.

item.title: Grand Rounds at Colorado Health Insurance Insider
item.description: Louise has this week’s Grand Rounds up at Colorado Health Insurance Insider.  Good reading on topics that are informative and sometimes controversial.  Stop by and have a look.

item.title: Grand Rounds at Health 3.0 Blog
item.description: This week’s Grand Rounds is up at Health 3.0 Blog.  Plenty of good posts, and if you like music with your reading, at the bottom of the page there are six versions of the song Goodnight Irene  for your listening enjoyment  - artists from Johnny Cash to Peter, Paul and Mary.

item.title: Grand Rounds at Dr. Pullen
item.description: Dr. Ed Pullen has this week’s Grand Rounds up at DrPullen.com.  As well as the usual range of subjects covered in the medical blogging world, he has gone further afield with a few interesting additions, including a recipe for raspberry pie.  Take a look when you have a chance to relax and read.

item.title: Grand Rounds at Medical Lessons
item.description: Dr. Elaine Schattner has Grand Rounds this week at Medical Lessons.  Not only has she put together some very interesting reading, but a range of photos from around the world.  In her call for submissions Dr. Schattner asked that bloggers submit a photo from their region, and she received some lovely images.  Have a look.

item.title: Grand Rounds at Better Health
item.description: Dr. Val Jones has this week’s Grand Rounds up at Better Health.   You can find reading material here for the entire week, as Dr. Jones has included more than forty posts.  Some are inspirational, like Dr. Ed Pullen’s Carpe Diem; others cover material that is hard to believe, as in Roy’s post Doctors to Go to Jail for Asking Patients about Guns in the Home.   Whatever your fields of interest, there will something for you.  Take a look.

item.title: Grand Rounds at Diabetes Mine
item.description: Grand Rounds is up at Diabetes Mine.  You will find the usual wide range of topics, so stop by and have a read.

item.title: Grand Rounds at The Covert Rationing Blog
item.description: DrRich has Grand Rounds up at The Covert Rationing Blog.  He has obviously put a lot of work into hosting this week’s rounds, with explanatory paragraphs concerning each entry.  The reader is easily able to discern what is covered in each submitted post, so stop by to have a look, and read further.

item.title: Grand Rounds at Gruntdoc
item.description: Grand Rounds is up at Gruntdoc.  As usual, Dr. Roberts presents a very user-friendly rounds, simple to follow, easy to use.   Close to thirty posts, with a wide range of subjects.    Stop by and have a look.

item.title: Grand Rounds at Suture for a Living
item.description: Grand Rounds is up at Suture for a Living.   Plastic surgeon Dr. Ramona Bates has included posts that cover many different subjects, some light, some serious.  Stop by and have a look.

item.title: Grand Rounds at Highlight Health
item.description: Grand Rounds is up at Highlight Health.  The theme is The Impact of Healthcare Reform, and Walter Jessen has included posts that cover many different perspectives on this timely subject.  Stop by and have a look.

item.title: Grand Rounds at Sharpbrains.com
item.description: Grand Rounds is up at sharpbrains.  Twenty-two health and medicine posts.  Plenty of reading for all on a wide range of subjects.

item.title: Grand Rounds at Musings of a Dinosaur
item.description: Grand Rounds is up at Musings of a Dinosaur. Plenty of reading covering many topics.

item.title: Grand Rounds at Inside Surgery
item.description: Grand Rounds is up at Inside Surgery. Sorted, well laid out, and plenty of reading on varied topics.

item.title: Grand Rounds at other things amanzi
item.description: Grand Rounds is up at other things amanzi. This week’s host is a surgeon in the province of Mpumalanga, South Africa. In addition to good reading, the rounds offers some very nice photos from the 2010 World Cup.

item.title: Grand Rounds at Getbetterhealth
item.description: Grand Rounds is up at Getbetterhealth.  Maria Gifford, newly-appointed content manager of Better Health, has done an excellent job of putting together this week’s rounds.  She uses a straightforward style that makes it easy to check out the various posts.

item.title: Grand Rounds at Parallel Universes
item.description: Grand Rounds is up at Parallel Universes.  Dr. Emer has very nicely taken an unthemed Rounds and sorted the posts into several interesting mini-themes.  From dealing with death to high risk  pools in the health insurance field, there is plenty of good reading.

item.title: Grand Rounds at MD Whistleblower
item.description: Grand Rounds is up at MD Whistleblower.  With so many posts on a wide range of subjects, there is plenty of reading for everyone.

item.title: Grand Rounds at Musings of a Distractible Mind
item.description: Grand Rounds is up at Musings of a Distractible Mind.  There are various categories (eleven groupings in all), with plenty of reading on a wide range of subjects.

item.title: Grand Rounds up at Medicblog999
item.description: Grand Rounds is up at medicblog999. There are both themed posts and open submissions. Plenty of reading for all on a wide range of subjects.

item.title: Grand Rounds Up at Emergiblog
item.description: Grand Rounds is up at Emergiblog, with many interesting posts.

item.title: Grand Rounds at Codeblog
item.description: Grand Rounds is up at codeblog. Plenty of good reading, including an interesting take on fund raising  by Duncan Cross at Don’t Walk.

item.title: Grand Rounds At APC Internist
item.description: Ryan DuBosar at the APC Internist has hosted a great grand rounds this week, with the best that the medical blogosphere has to offer. He followed a newspaper format, and there’s even a funnies section. Head over and check it out.
